block.p: Elizabeth Brooke Stern, the daughter of Nancy Z. Lane of New York and the stepdaughter of Jeffrey B. Lane, was married yesterday to Jeffrey Daniel Rudnick, the son of Gail and David L. Rudnick of Palm Beach, Fla. Rabbi Peter Rubinstein officiated at the Plaza in New York.

Mrs. Rudnick, 27, is a vice president at Salomon Smith Barney, the New York investment bank, where she manages the firm's effort to attract women as clients. She graduated from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor. Her father, the late Mark G. Stern, was a partner in Koenig, Ratner & Mott, a New York law firm. Her mother is an interior designer in New York. The bride's stepfather is the president and chief executive of Neuberger Berman, the New York money management company.

Elizabeth Brooke Stern, the daughter of Nancy Z. Lane of New York and the stepdaughter of Jeffrey B. Lane, was married yesterday to Jeffrey Daniel Rudnick, the son of Gail and David L. Rudnick of Palm Beach, Fla. Rabbi Peter Rubinstein officiated at the Plaza in New York.

Mrs. Rudnick, 27, is a vice president at Salomon Smith Barney, the New York investment bank, where she manages the firm's effort to attract women as clients. She graduated from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor. Her father, the late Mark G. Stern, was a partner in Koenig, Ratner & Mott, a New York law firm. Her mother is an interior designer in New York. The bride's stepfather is the president and chief executive of Neuberger Berman, the New York money management company.

Mr. Rudnick, 30, is the senior vice president and his father is the president of Century Associates Group, a company they own in Rochelle Park, N.J., which owns and manages shopping centers and office buildings. The bridegroom, who graduated from Duke University, received a master's degree in real estate and an M.B.A. from New York University.
